description: UMD 1.1.0 is the 2nd release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains only the most critical products from EGI's Technology Providers as agreed by the TCB (Technology Coordination Board) on behalf of the EGI community.
releaseNotes: This release contains updates for &nbsp;<b>Proxyrenewal</b>,&nbsp;<b>UNICORE</b>&nbsp;<b>UVOS</b>,&nbsp;<b>Logging and Bookkeeping</b>,&nbsp;<b>BDII-core</b>&nbsp;and introduces <b>ARC Infosys</b> and&nbsp;<b>STORM</b>&nbsp;into the UMD.
installationNotes: <p class="p1">This is the second release of the UMD-1 that is made available for EGI's production infrastructure. &nbsp;All products in the&nbsp;<b>UMD 1.1.0&nbsp;</b>release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64bit Scientific Linux 5 (x86_64 processor architecture). &nbsp;Installation notes and known issues are collected on a per-product basis, and are available in the EGI Wiki. When browsing the EGI Repository, each product available in this release will provide a link to the respective entry in the mentioned Wiki space, providing specific information about any issues discovered during Verification and/or StagedRollout. &nbsp;For more information on EGI's Software Provisioning process, see&nbsp;<a href="https://documents.egi.eu/document/505">MS508</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://documents.egi.eu/document/478">MS409</a>.</p>
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/pages/home.php">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report
knownIssues: <p class="p1">As this is the second release of UMD-1, and uses a different structure than previous releases of these products, each product must be installed from scratch as in-place updates are not supported for non UMD releases &nbsp;If you are upgrading from UMD 1.0.0 release then in-place upgrades are supported. Please consult the product specific installation instructions provided by EMI, the Technology Provider delivering the components in this release.</p><p class="p1">Additional installation notes are collected on a per-product base, and are available in the&nbsp;<a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.1.0">EGI Wiki</a>&nbsp;(see Additional Details for more information)</p>
changeLog:
<p class="p1">In this release we have included the following</p>
<p class="p1"></p><ul><li><b>Product Updates: </b>&nbsp;Proxyrenewal 1.3.21, UNICORE UVOS 1.4.2, Logging and Bookkeeping 3.0.12<br></li><li><b>Product Releases:</b>&nbsp;ARC Infosys 1.0.0, STORM 1.7.0</li></ul>Note: ARC Infosys and STORM should be installed from scratch since upgrades from previous versions are <i>not supported</i>.

products.name: emi.arc-infosys
products.description:
The ARC middleware implements a scalable, production quality dynamic distributed information system.

The ARC information system has been deployed and being used in a large scale production environment since

May 2002. As of writing, the information system aggregates 70 resources providing Globus ToolkitTM40

thousand CPUs and serves Globus ToolkitTM400 thousand jobs per month.
products.releaseNotes:
What's new:

-----------

* Support for publishing resource information using LDAP rendering of glue2 within ARIS.

* Initial support for making ARIS act as a site-bdii (experimental).

* Improved file locking in the EGIIS index server relay utility.

* Stability fixes in both ARIS and EGIIS.

* Improved handling of non-ascii information

* The start-up script now handles bad shutdowns properly

* Fix for publishing of draining remote grid-manager directories



Deployment notes:

-----------------

* There are no changes in the Grid Monitor deployment.

* The ARIS is deployed by installing the nordugrid-arc-aris package. If you are upgrading from an earlier release, the update should be automatic from any of the previous packages (nordugrid-arc-infosys-ldap, nordugrid-arc-nox-ldap-infosys).

* The EGIIS is deployed by installing the nordugrid-arc-egiis package. If you are updating from an earlier release, the update from nordugrid-arc-nox-giis should be automatic. A meta package nordugrid-arc-information-index is also provided to easy deployment.

* In order to keep publishing the same information as before in ARIS, no configuration changes are needed.

* New configuration options were introduced for enabling  publishing new information in ARIS:

In order to enable or disable different information schemas in the output, the following variables can be set in the [infosys] section of the arc.conf (defaults as indicated below):

infosys_nordugrid="enable"

infosys_glue12="disable"

infosys_glue2_ldap="disable"



In order to publish site bdii information a new [infosys/site/<sitename>] section should be added to the arc.conf configuration file, containing a unique_id option identifying the site and a url option giving the address to the resource bdii.

* There are no configuration changes for EGIIS



Known Issues 

------------

* none
products.changeLog: Put the Change logs here (multiline field)

products.name: emi.bdii-core
products.description: The resource-level BDII is an instance of the BDII that contains information about a Grid Service and is typically deployed with the service itself. It consists of an OpenLDAP database that is periodically updated by a parallel process that obtains information about the Grid Service from one or more information sources.
products.releaseNotes:
* What's new:

This bdii release addresses an incompatibility issue with the ARC infosys.



* Deployment Notes:

No re-configuration is required and the service should automatically restart on installation of the package.
products.changeLog: Put the Change logs here (multiline field)

products.name: emi.lb
products.description: The Logging and Bookkeeping service (LB) tracks jobs in terms of events (important points of job life, e.g. submission, finding a matching CE, starting execution etc.) gathered from various WMS components as well as CEs (all those have to be instrumented with LB calls).
products.releaseNotes:
What's new:



    * Fixes for several bugs

          o False background purge error messages

          o Problems with L&B server dump

          o Safe reaction to overly long HTTPs request headers

          o Fixed default path in glite-lb-purge.cron

    * A few more memory handling improvements

 

Deployment notes:

    * emi-lb metapackage is installed by yum.

    * yaim configuration requires, at the very least, setting MYSQL_PASSWORD, SITE_NAME and SITE_EMAIL in the site-info.def file.

    * Reconfiguration is required. Reconfiguration using YAIM will restart the service automatically.

 

Known Issues:

    * Due to faulty DNS over IPv6 resolution in the c-ares library (v. 1.6.0), L&B does not work in most scenarios involving IPv6-only machines. Upgrade c-ares to 1.7.3 and relaunch yaim to get full IPv6 functionality.

    * Background purge works and return code is handled correctly. It also results in a clean termination of a slave, though, which is currently reported by the master to syslog with priority 'Error' despite being harmless (The actual wording is 'Slave \d exited with return code 1'). This does not pose a problem, just a false alarm for a person reading the logs.
products.changeLog: Put the Change logs here (multiline field)

products.name: emi.proxyrenewal
products.description:
The proxy renewal daemon runs as an internal component of the WMS node, which is responsible for

keeping proxy certificates valid throughout all the lifetime of corresponding jobs. The daemon maintains

a repository of proxy certificates that have been registered by the WMS for renewal. After succesfull

registration of a proxy, the WMS refers to the repository file whenever it needs access the proxy of a

particular job. When the finishes the WMS unregisters the proxy from the repository.
products.releaseNotes:
What's new:

This is a bugfix release for the previous version of ProxyRenewal, containing the following improvements:

    * Workaround for problems with threaded globus by setting signal mask (SB #81371)

    * Preventive 'kill -9' into the startup script

    * Improved logging, more descriptive error messages

    * Corrected log levels

    * Increased backlog queue of listen(2)

    * Command identifiers added to some logs

    * Correct handling of multiple VOMS ACs (from multiple VOMS servers)

 

Deployment

Upon update, restart the ProxyRenewal daemon by calling /etc/init.d/glite-proxy-renewald restart

 

Known Issues:

None for ProxyRenewal

products.name: emi.storm
products.description:
The StoRM service is a storage resource manager for generic disk based storage systems separating the

data management layer from the underlying storage systems.
products.releaseNotes:
StoRM-Front-End

    * What's new

          o First storm-frontend-server release in EMI. Previous releases are available via INFN-Grid

          o Fixed bug 107 (GGUS 70934)

    * Installation and configuration

          o To install storm-frontend-server, install its metapackage RPM: emi-storm-frontend-server-mp

          o To configure storm-frontend-server use yaim on node se_storm_frontend. A good explanation of the required YAIM variable is available in /opt/glite/yaim/examples/siteinfo/services/se_storm_frontend

    * Known issues

          o None



StoRM-Back-end-Server

    * What's new

          o First storm-backend-server release in EMI. Previous releases are available via INFN-Grid

          o tape support (features usable in combination with GEMSS, based on GPFS and TSM)

          o sanity check at service startup

          o http(s) file transfer protocol support

          o Fixed bug 109 ((GGUS 68230)

          o Fixed bug 106 (GGUS 65155)

    * Installation and configuration

          o To install storm-backend-server, install its metapackage RPM: emi-storm-backend-server-mp

          o To configure storm-backend-server use yaim on node se_storm_backend. A good explanation of the required YAIM variable is available in /opt/glite/yaim/examples/siteinfo/services/se_storm_backend

          o If you configure other services with yaim on the same host always specify also se_storm_backend node

    * Known issues : None



StoRM-GridFTP-Server

    * What's new

          o First storm-gridfts-server release in EMI. Previous releases are available via INFN-Grid

          o Fixed bug 108 (GGUS 70751)

    * Installation and configuration

          o To install storm-gridftp-server, install its metapackage RPM: emi-storm-gridftp-server-mp

          o To configure storm-gridftp-server use yaim on node se_storm_gridftp. A good explanation of the required YAIM variable is available in /opt/glite/yaim/examples/siteinfo/services/se_storm_gridftp

          o The service needs to be installed on a machine on which storm file system is mounted.

    * Known issues

          o None



StoRM-GridHTTPS-Server

    * What's new

          o First storm-gridhttps-server release.

          o The storm gridhttps service is responsible to provide access to storm managed files via http and https protocol.

          o It is able to manage plain requests and requests over SSL using an x509 certificate or an x509 certificate with VOMS extensions.

          o For the requests providing a valid x509 certificate file access priviledges are verified in respect to the certificate owner and (if available) his FQANS.

    * Installation and configuration

          o To install storm-gridhttps-server install its metapackage RPM: emi-storm-gridhttps-mp

          o To configure storm-gridhttps-server use yaim on node se_storm_gridhttps. A good explanation of the required YAIM variable is available in /opt/glite/yaim/examples/siteinfo/services/se_storm_gridhttps

          o The service uses ports 8443 and (by default) 8080, so open them on your firewall.

          o The service needs to be installed on a machine on which storm file system is mounted.

    * Known issues

          o None



StoRM-SRM-Client

    * What's new

          o First storm-srm-client release in EMI. Previous releases are available via INFN-Grid

    * Installation and configuration

          o To install storm-srm-client, install its metapackage RPM: emi-storm-srm-client-mp

    * Known issues

          o None
products.changeLog: Put the Change logs here (multiline field)

products.name: emi.unicore-uvos
products.description: UNICORE VO Service (UVOS) is a client-server system, developed to be used as an additional tool for large distributed systems, providing a solution for grid users management. Grid systems, especially UNICORE grid middleware, are the mainspring of the UVOS system. UVOS can be used with different systems, however is designed primarily to support UNICORE grid middleware.
products.releaseNotes:
What's new for UVOS server:

    * UVOS server was updated to use latest persistence libraries (JDBC drivers, MyBatis 3).

    * Support for MySQL database backend was added.

    * Support for attribute filtering on SAML interface is available.

    * Documentation was updated.

 

Installation and configuration:

    * There are no special issues regarding the fresh installation.

    * The standard yum update procedure can be taken, i.e. administrator should check if there are any .rpmnew or .rpmsave files after performing the update and merge changes according to the latest documentation. In this release such situation can happen in case of one file: uvosServer.conf.



 

Know issues:

NONE
